alert.note: Alert for Mahaska; Marion; Poweshiek (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 4:19PM CDT until March 31 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: The National Weather Service in Des Moines has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Monroe County in south central Iowa... Southeastern Poweshiek County in central Iowa... Southeastern Marion County in south central Iowa... Mahaska County in south central Iowa... * Until 515 PM CDT. * At 418 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 6 miles southwest of Lovilia, or 10 miles west of Albia, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Lovilia around 425 PM CDT. Bussey and Hamilton around 430 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Eddyville, Beacon, Oskaloosa, University Park, Keomah Village, Lake Keomah State Park, Oskaloosa Municipal Airport and Rose Hill. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for south central, central and southeastern Iowa.
